subject: Vam telemetry issue
description_text:
Hi I have the simsonn pro x pedals and I just also got the vam pedal motors
recently.    I'm having an issue with the simsonn software recognizing the
game is running but it says that telemetry is not connected.  So far I've
gotten it to work with assetto corsa but not with dirt really 2.0 or
automobilista 2. Both those games say telemetry is not connected.

Would appreciate any help!


Also while I'm here, I noticed that with the pro x pedals if I have the RGB
lights on. They never turn off even when I turn off my PC.    I have to go
in to the simsonn software and toggle the light switch option whenever I
want to turn on or off the lights. Might be nice to add some options to
auto turn off either when the software is closed or PC is turned off in a
future software update.

Thanks!

conversations.body_text: Hi LacedChemist,  We’ll be releasing a new version 2.0.9 soon, which will support the two games you mentioned. In the meantime, you can also download SimHub version 9.9.3, which supports over 100 games and is fully compatible with our pedal devices.

Thank you for your response.

I was able to install simhub and get it set up properly.

Unfortunately, I keep having an issue where the vam motors stop working mid
race/after a couple of races. I think the longest I've had them work so far
is like 15 minutes before they stop responding.

When they stop working. I noticed that in the simsonn software my pedal
inputs stop showing up in the position input bar. Like they stop
registering how far I push the pedals down in the software like they
normally do.

The only way to get it all to work again is a PC restart.

On Sun, Jul 6, 2025, 8:44 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi LacedChemist,    You can update the software to version 2.0.9, which automatically limits the maximum vibration strength of the VAM motors to prevent overload damage. For ProX pedals, we recommend setting the vibration strength between 15% and 30%, which is already sufficient for maximum feedback. Please do not exceed this range. The same rule applies when using SimHub—avoid running the VAM motors continuously for long periods, especially when triggered by telemetry like speed or RPM.  We also recommend swapping the VAM motor connections on the control box to identify which motor is faulty. Once confirmed, we will send you a free replacement for the damaged unit.

Hi. Yeah I don't believe the problem is with the motors. They all work fine
for a short time and then all stop working/responding to the game telemetry
until I restart my computer.

The motors also stay on when they stop responding to the game telemetry
 and the simsonn software stops showing my pedal pressure inputs.

The motors continue vibrating constantly when the software stops responding.



I believe it's a software issue.

On Thu, Jul 17, 2025, 1:51 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi LacedChemist,  If the device stops working after running for some time, please note that in our test environment it remains connected stably for days. This issue is typically caused by unstable USB power supply or electromagnetic interference from external wheelbases. First, you must use the blue USB 3.0 port on the back of the computer and avoid USB hubs to ensure a stable power supply. In addition, please refer to the video about USB sleep ports causing frequent disconnections and the video on grounding the wheelbase to the PC chassis to prevent interference.      https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LciAFDFWJ1w     https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding
